title: 1997년 United States v. Javier Trevino 사건
summary: 미국 USA, Federal 법원 판결 사건. 사건명: United States v. Javier Trevino. 판결일: 1997-12-22. 법원: Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit.
description:
## 사건 정보

**사건명**: UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff-Appellee, v. Javier TREVINO, Defendant-Appellant
**판결일**: 1997-12-22
**법원**: Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit
**관할**: USA, Federal

**판사**: Jolly, Jones, Smith

## 변호인

Tanya K. Pierce, Assistant U.S. Attorney, Lubbock, TX, for Plaintiff-Appellee., Jaime Cavazos, Cavazos & Ortiz, San Antonio, TX, for Defendant-Appellant.

## 인용

- 131 F.3d 1140

## 판결문 요약

131 F.3d 1140
    UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff-Appellee,v.Javier TREVINO, Defendant-Appellant.
    No. 97-10438
    
      Summary Calendar.
      United States Court of Appeals,Fifth Circuit.
      Dec. 22, 1997.
      Tanya K. Pierce, Assistant U.S. Attorney, Lubbock, TX, for Plaintiff-Appellee.
      Jaime Cavazos, Cavazos & Ortiz, San Antonio, TX, for Defendant-Appellant.
      Appeal from the United States District Court for the Northern District of Texas.
      Before JOLLY, JONES and SMITH, Circuit Judges.
      EDITH H. JONES, Circuit Judge:
    
    
      1
      Appellant Trevino, having pleaded guilty to participating in a conspiracy to distribute cocaine from 1993 through July 1996 and to a specific instance of possession with intent to distribute cocaine on May 22, 1996, contests his sentence under the Guidelines.  He contends that he was erroneously given an additional criminal history point, pursuant to U.S.S.G. § 4A1.1(e), based on the court's finding that his offense was committed within two years from his release from custody on a prior relevant sentence.  Trevino contends that "the instant offense" and all relevant conduct for sentencing purposes occurred on May 22, 1996, more than two years after his release from imprisonment.  We disagree and AFFIRM the sentence issued by the trial court.
    
    
      2
      Trevino's argument hinges on the assumption that he was not linked to the conspiracy count, to which he pled guilty, prior to th...
